entry.title: Bees In The Wind
entry.summary:
Author: RealSugababy

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,057Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 23

Summary: When Damian turned 18 his father sat him down for a talk, THE talk. However, when your father is Batman and you are a crime fighter yourself, the talk is not the one most teenagers have with their parents.“As you know there are various risks in our profession,” he started. Damian arched a brow. Of course, he knew this. One didn't grow up in the League of Assassins and become one of the most fearsome crime-fighting vigilantes without risk. “But there is a specific type of risk which I have shielded you from so far that has now become relevant,” Bruce said.“And what is this risk?” Damian asked, his curiosity eating at him. Bruce said nothing for a long second.“The sexual risk.”--OR Damian gets hit with sex pollen and Jon helps him out.

entry.title: Operation: Sleep Well, Destroy Better
entry.summary:
Author: Hasunohana

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,182Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 52

Summary: Clark Kent's marriage to Bruce Wayne threw him straight into the chaos of the Batfam—a den of chronic insomnia and neglected self-care. Determined to enforce at least a bare minimum of healthy routine, Clark declared war on sleepless nights and diets of pure black coffee.Some accepted the changes reluctantly. But Tim Drake? Tim was a whole other challenge.After countless failed attempts to convince him to take better care of himself, Clark decided to fight dirty. The offer? 90 days of regulated sleep and less coffee in exchange for a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity—to humiliate Lex Luthor.Now, the looming question: Will Tim hold up his end of the deal, or will his work obsession (and caffeine addiction) sabotage his own revenge?

entry.title: If you like your coffee hot (let me be your coffee pot)
entry.summary:
Author: emme

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,049Chapters: 2/6Kudos: 31

Summary: Batman didn’t sleep; he didn’t rest, nor did he take breaks. He didn’t acknowledge his injuries, his weaknesses, or his limitations. Batman was the night, and the night is relentless, unforgiving, unstoppable.Bruce, on the other hand… he didn’t sleep, he didn’t rest, nor did he take breaks either, but he desperately needed to. Clark couldn’t do much about that. He couldn’t very well force the man to take a nap (even if sometimes he wished he could just push him down on a flat surface, effectively close his eyes, and order him to sleep). What he could do, however, was ensure Bruce kept an adequate energy level, the kind of energy level that allows a human being to stand upright, walk, talk, and generally survive life with minimal discomfort.He… fed him. Clark fed him whenever he could.The situation was not spiraling out of control. He could very well handle things, and “acts of service” was not Superman’s love language. It was not.Or:Five times Clark brought food to Bruce and one time he didn’t have to, but he did it anyway.

entry.title: Identity Crisis
entry.summary:
Author: secretidentie (KentWayne)

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,717Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 44

Summary: When Bruce goes training over seas he makes an online friend that he also starts falling in love with. They still talk everyday years later but have never met in person because Bruce doesn't want to risk his identity as batman being discovered. After an argument with superman, Bruce decides it's time to move on from his online friend in pursuit of a reporter at a gala.This reporter, Clark Kent, is in town investigating shady shipments connected to Lex Luthor. During this investigation he crosses paths with a criminal known as Matches Malone and starts falling for him even though he knows he shouldn't. While he knows it's a bad idea to get romantically involved with Matches, he reasons this as a good way to get over his unrequited crush on Batman (who definitely hates him) like his online pen pal, Gray, has been begging him to do for years.While Clark's set on pursuing Matches, Bruce Wayne's efforts to win him over don't go unnoticed. At the same time it still hurts to let go of his feelings for batman. It's a good thing he has Gray to talk him through it.

entry.title: Hidden in Plain Sight
entry.summary:
Author: karinkozuken

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 19,461Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 199

Summary: Bruce Wayne liked Clark Kent. He wouldn’t call it love, but there was something about the clumsy reporter that intrigued him. Except, there was one problem: Clark Kent seemed to despise him. Cold glares, curt words, and an air of disapproval followed Bruce whenever Clark was around.Superman, on the other hand, liked Batman. But he would rather face Batman powerless than confess his feelings. And with Batman’s mistrust of him, his obsession with secrecy, and his reluctance to form any real bond made Superman feel like he could never close the gap between them, even though all he wanted was to be closer.

entry.title: A Moment To Breathe
entry.summary:
Author: mustangisinflames

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,685Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 48

Summary: Batman drew back, finally turning to look at him with coal dark eyes, the whites of them bright against the paint framing them. The cut along his cheek and jaw was gone, nothing more than the faint impression of a silvery line at the microscopic level, a five o’clock shadow smudging it out. Clark’s gaze alighted on the new texture of the undersuit, cuts of matte carbon fibre, faint traces of sea salt caught in the weave. A patchwork of night and shadow and the fog that lingered in the spaces between buildings. Sweat mixing with the oil of greasepaint, the synthetic plastic stink of kevlar and the high cut notes of steel.It was the closest Clark had been to him since that night in the alleyway the first time they’d met. Close enough to feel the warmth radiating off him, to watch the way the weak glow of lamp and floodlights caught on his cowl. Close enough to touch.“Hn,” Batman grunted and the sound rumbled from deep within his breastplate.“You called for me,” Clark said, “Why?” Or: Batman calls for Superman.
